trial_identification.studytitle: Oxytocin as an adjunct to interaction coaching and baby massage to improve bonding in the early postpartum.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A study examining the effects of placebo/oxytocin and baby massage and interaction coaching/information support on early postpartum mothers bonding experiences.

conditions.healthcondition: Mothers with some degree of postnatal depression who report bonding difficulties

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: Mothers receive oxytocin (prepared by chemists) via a nasal spray(24IU) once at the beginning of the session, over two consecutive days. Participants who are given oxytocin are randomly allocated to either interaction coaching/baby massage or informational videos. The videos are of 30 minutes duration and are presented immediately following delivery of the nasal spray.
interventions.comparator: Mothers receive placebo (contains the same ingredients as the oxytocin mixture but without the active ingredient) via a nasal spray(24IU) once at the beginning of the session, over two consecutive days. Participants who are given placebo are randomly allocated to either interaction coaching/baby massage or informational videos. The videos are of 30 minutes duration and are presented immediately following delivery of the nasal spray.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Video observation of mothers interacting with their infants is coded for bonding behaviours by the researchers.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Mother's self reported bonding with their infants (questionnaires)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Primiparous mothers who report some degree of depression and report and impaired bond with their infants
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnancy, epliepsy, psychotic symptoms, hypotension, heart condition, allergy to preservatives. Infant birth defects.

trial_design.concealment: Allocation schedule is held offsite and drugs are in numbered containers
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation from a randomisation table.
trial_design.designfeatures: Interaction coaching and massage training is single blind for the participant but not for the administer of the treatment. Assessment of outcomes is blinded.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A between subjects randomized controlled trial is being used to assess the efficacy of oxytocin delivered alongside interaction coaching and massage to improve maternal behaviour towards the infant.
